page.title: 19FARMING NEAR MARKFIELD
page.content: My dad gets up at 5a.m. He puts on his overalls.He goes into the kitchen and makes himself some coffee.His wellies have been next to the radiator so they are nice and warm to put on.The cows are waiting for him outside.They go into a barn and some go through to be milked. The cows' udders are washed. When the cows have been milked the pigs are fed on scraps and pig food. My dad then goes in for his breakfast.In the winter he must clean out the animals between the milking and his dinner. In the summer he would do some combining or some silaging.After dinner he would carry on with his silaging which would take up to 7p.m.A helper does the evening milking. My dad is very tired then and he comes in for his tea and a rest.
